[About JERA]
JERA Group with the headquarter located in Japan, is an energy/power company with fuel transaction volume among the world's highest. Our mission is to provide cutting-edge solutions to the world's energy issues. In order to become a global leader in LNG and renewables, sparking the transition to a clean energy economy, as well as achieving a decarbonized society, we are planning a major reorganization to transform our Singapore entity (JERA Asia) into a regional headquarters for APAC region.
Based on this background, we are looking for a well-experienced IT Specialist to lead the IT Infrastructure which includes establishing IT Strategy, Planning, Investment, Cost Management, Information Security Management, IT Architecture Management, Out-souring Management, Project Management, IT Services and Asset Management (includes maintenance, application, user supports). This position is required to manage the entire IT Infrastructure and ensure its operations are compliant to the Headquarters IT policy requirements.
[Job Description]
1. Establish/Implement/Management of IT strategic planning (including IT compliance for re-organization of JERA Asia)
2. Draw-up/Implement/Management of various IT policies/regulations, which includes investment/cost, security, architecture, sourcing, project, IT service and fixed assets etc.
3. Work closely with ICT team in the Headquarters for introducing the entire JERA group strategy, IT governance, security policy etc to JERA Asia, and compile periodic IT report to the ICT team in good command of Japanese and English language.
4. To lead and implement IT Solution Planning, such as implementation of SAP in the areas of Human Resource and Accounting, and OA related implementation (includes data intelligence, digital signature solutions etc).
5. Provide hands-on supports on PC/iPhone setting (procuring/application of application license etc).
6. Works as a window person to provide IT support to all users in JERA Asia for daily PC troubleshooting, maintenance/incident support, provide IT security education to users, well understanding in group companies network infrastructure in terms of TV conference system etc
[Required experience and knowledge]
Mininum 10-years of hands-on experience in the following capacities:
1. 2-years of hands-on experience in strategic planning which relates to Information System
2. 3-years of hands-on experience as a project management in Business Application
3. 3-years of hands-on experience in developing, maintenance and operation of Business Application (experience in SAP will be an advantage)
4. 2-years hands-on experience in developing, maintenance and operation of Business Application Infrastructure (experience in public cloud such as Microsoft Azure, AWS etc)
5. 3-years hands-on experience in a Corporate's OA (infrastructure business support, such as Office365, PC, iPhone, multifunction device, group companies network etc)
6. 1-year of hands-on IT user level support, such as service desk etc.
7. 2-years of hands-on experience in cyber security
[Capabilities / other elements to be considered]
1. Develop plans for infrastructure capacity enhancement to support the infrastructure strategy
2. Anticipate how an organization's infrastructure will evolve over time with technological trends and developments
3. Develop and drive action plans for the key changes or new directions in IT strategy
4. Evaluate impact of changes by reviewing IT business process models and their outcomes
5. Motivation to work in energy industry
6. Understanding of culture and business manner of Japanese companies
7. How keen on the JERA's mission & vision
8. Professional backgrounds
9. Education backgrounds

column7:
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (Activate) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. The homegrown company was founded in 1997 with the mission of positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology.
We offer quality, cost-effective and impactful IT solutions and services, including mobile and web applications and cloud technology. Over the years, we have helped government agencies and enterprises remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency to better serve the communities.
To amplify our efforts in improving people's lives, Activate also develops preventive healthcare solutions that serve to increase health awareness and improve population health.
We believe that the success of a company relies on the strengths of our employees. At Activate, we are committed to provide a conducive environment and develop our employees to realise their full potential.
From a three-person outfit, Activate has grown into a team of more than 150 employees, delivering more than 150 solutions and services to help our clients achieve growth and success.

column7:
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 900 employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we've set out to build the future of AI.
Dataiku's mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modelling, deployment, and more. But it's not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.
We are seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner to join our team in APAC.
Reporting to the Sales Enablement Manager, the Sales Enablement Business Partner will ensure that effective selling doesn't happen by chance - it is formulaic.
The Sales Enablement Business Partner will contribute to the success of the Account Executive and Inside Sales teams by providing them with all the relevant (localized) training and content they need to sell Dataiku. There is a lot for the Account Executive and Inside Sales teams to know and master, it is the job of the Sales Enablement Business Partner to bring focus and intention to learning. This is a highly visible individual contributor position where quality, clarity, and scalability are paramount to the candidate's success.
You must be willing and able to partner with your stakeholders (revenue leadership) to ensure the effective enablement of teams on the ground
What you will do:
Overseeing and owning the enablement strategy/program of APAC Account Executive and Inside Sales teams with the objective of improving sales efficiency in their revenue growing and pipeline efforts.
Build a culture of Feedback and drive desire for enablement and learning across leadership
Help sales managers build a healthy pipeline by building and providing relevant training and content
Attend sales team meetings in your region in order to understand where to focus your efforts in upcoming training
Coach Account Executive and Inside Sales teams during 1 on 1 session (shadowing calls, practicing pitching, role plays, review messaging)
Partner with the BDR Productivity Manager to build a library of excellence (discovery calls, outreach sequences, snippets, videos)
Planning, scheduling, and facilitating elective/sequenced training, and 3rd party vendor training, whether in-person or virtual
Tracking and measuring the effectiveness of all initiatives (training and content) and providing actionable insights and feedback to Global Sales Enablement
Maintain updated training content in a Learning Management System (LMS), where appropriate
25% Travel
Your qualifications:
At least 5 years experience in a sales training or related experience role
Background working in sales or sales enablement (tech knowledge preferred)
Bachelor's degree, preferably in communication, education, or related field
Preferred qualifications:
Exceptional (and executive) communication
Experience in data science or cloud space preferred
Demonstrated experience developing curriculum that is in line with current industry and adult learning standards
Knowledge of Customer-Centric Selling or similar sales methodology
Experience with coordination, collaboration, and stakeholder management at a global scale Demonstrated ability to assess training effectiveness and present ROI to stakeholders and leaders
Knowledge of tools: Outreach, Salesforce, Sales Navigator, Gong

column7:
KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
1. System Maintenance
Provide maintenance and support for assigned applications, assess downtime cause, co-ordinate with the infrastructure and/or security team(s) for any OS, hardware, security, policies, switch, firewall, etc. findings that will help with resolving the issue, co-ordinate with users on maintenance schedules, escalate and engage vendor, if any vendor support is required. Anaylse logs, transactions, activities, etc. that could potentially contribute to the system downtime, bring-up and restore the core function for continuity of the business, resolve the malfunction of the application, identify the root cause of the issue, plan and implement measures for future incident prevention, and if required plan for future upgrade
Initiate license and/or maintenance contract renewal whenever required.
Ensure continuous system usability to serve the business needs and increase system reliability.
2. System Changes and Support
Understand user requirement, analyse the impact of the change request, manage, develop and implement the change request including any changes to the interfacing and dependent systems, counter propose any process improvements or changes to ensure the changes are not piecemeal and changes meet the customer's expectations and requirements. Seek approval before developing the changes, document the test script, plan and execute for SIT, if any, end user testing, update system processes in order to ensure system continues to serve the dynamic business needs.
3. Automation and New System deployment
Evaluate opportunities to automate manual processes and inform supervisor on possible automation for further evaluation TO improve productivity and increase efficiency.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Graduate Degree/Diploma in Computer Science or Computer Studies or Information Technology or related disciplines
PREFERRED SKILLS & CHARACTERISTICS
Ability to work in a team as well as independently
Ability to communicate across different functions and levels of audiences
Effective at acquiring an understanding of a problem or situation, with good problem-solving skill.
Previous experience with software development and application support is an advantage
General knowledge of hardware (server spec) and networking (client/server architecture, switch, firewall, LAN) is an advantage
Minimum 5 years of experience
Self-driven and proactive in keeping up with new technologies and programming
Must have strong technical knowledge of application development
Experience in any 3 of the following domain area/ technology/ programming languages
o C#, ASP.NET, HTML5, CSS3, & JavaScript, .NET 5, .NET Core, .NET Framework and/or Web API
o Microsoft SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance and/or Cosmos DB
o AKS, Azure Web App, Azure Storage, Container Registry and/or Azure Key Vault
o Azure Logic App, Azure API Management, Azure Service Bus, and/or Azure Data Factory
o Microsoft SharePoint Online, Jira Software Customization and/or Microsoft Teams Integration/Development
o Microsoft Power Platforms (Power BI, Power Automate, Power App and/or Power Virtual Agent)
o Azure DevOps, CI/CD Pipeline and/or DevOps tool chains
Knowledge and experience in cloud-native application development will be added advantages.
Certified in Microsoft technologies will be added advantages.

column6: Machine Learning  Python  Data Science  Databases  Genomics  Data Analysis  academia  Interpersonal Skills  Physics  Oncology  Mathematics  Biology  Drug Discovery  Bioinformatics  computational biology
column7:
Opportunity to work at the cutting edge of drug development
Hummingbird Bioscience is an innovative clinical-stage biotech company focused on developing precision therapies against hard-to-drug targets to improve treatment outcomes. We harness the latest advances in systems biology and data science to better understand and solve the underlying causes of disease and guide development of our therapeutics.
Enabled by our proprietary Rational Antibody Discovery platform, we discover antibodies against optimal yet elusive epitopes on important targets that have not been successfully drugged, unlocking novel mechanisms of action. We are advancing a rich pipeline of first- and best-in-class precision therapies in oncology and autoimmunity, in collaboration with global partners in academia and industry.
Our highly experienced teams in the US and Singapore span antibody discovery, pharmacology, production, and clinical development. Together we aim to accelerate the journey of new drugs from concept to clinical care. For more information, please visit www.hummingbirdbioscience.com, and follow Hummingbird on LinkedIn and Twitter (@hummingbirdbio).
About the Role
Reporting to the Head of Computational Biology and Genomics, this role will also involve close collaboration with the Chief Technology Officer for the analysis of cutting edge multi-omic and spatial data from the latest sequencing platforms. This position demands a high level of bioinformatics knowledge and genomic technologies. You will be leading workstreams to analyse unique cutting-edge multi-modal datasets to provide new insights into disease biology, develop new bioinformatics infrastructure as well as working closely with wet-lab colleagues to plan experiments and help deliver the next generation of antibody therapeutics.
Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):
Analysis of genomic, transcriptomic, multi-modal and scRNA datasets
Analysis of spatial transcriptomic data
Analysis of B and T-cell receptor datasets in the context of antigen screening assays
Mining and integration of publicly available datasets
Automation of QC processes
Identification and benchmarking of gene signatures for Precision Medicine
Creation and curation of internal data silos and databases
Development of interactive resources to support other teams (e.g. Shiny Apps)
Design and configure data flows from wet-lab instrument platforms in collaboration with the IT team
Critically analyse and interpret data and accurately document and communicate results to other teams
Core Experience and Qualifications
PhD degree or equivalent experience in related fields including physics, mathematics, engineering, biology or other related discipline with demonstrated scientific acumen
At least 3 years of professional experience in the biopharma industry/academia/CRO
Deep familiarity with machine learning algorithms in the context of biology/medicine
Deep familiarity with Unix/Linux and Docker/Singularity as well as Python, Rust, R and/or other commonly used programming languages
Familiarity with cloud computing environments such as AWS is a plus
Knowledge of pipeline management approaches such as CWL, SnakeMake, NextFlow etc
Experience of working to best practice in bioinformatics for reproducible science
Experience in drug discovery and/or drug development preferred
Demonstrated project management skills is a pre-requisite
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, along with the ability to work in cross-functional project teams
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to advance multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

column6: Wireframes  Kubernetes  Scrum  User Stories  UI  Data Governance  JIRA  Data Architecture  Gcp  Data Warehousing  Architectural  Banking  Stakeholder Management  Credit Risk
column7:
Job specification
The Data Product Owner Chapter Lead role is a fairly unique role encompassing both a handson product owner role for the data platform as well as a management role overseeing the other data product owners working on data products for different areas of the business.
The data organisation (chapter) is primarily partitioned into a platform team and a collection of data solutions teams.
Data platform PO component
The platform team is responsible for the setup, creation and operation of infrastructure and tooling used by data engineers, data scientists and data analysts across the organisation. As the organisation grows, we require more sophisticated and standardised tooling to manage problems associated with scale. Such problems span governance problems including data discoverability, quality, lineage, privacy as well as generally providing greater developer experience and productivity to enable us to build a more data and AI driven product. In this respect we need a data product owner to help engage with the customers of the data platform team, i.e. the data engineers, scientists and analysts using the tooling, to help shape the platform. This will involve helping build both developer tools and UI based tools, but the focus will be more on developer experience than UI.
Requirements in this respect include:
PO experience working on designing both front end and importantly complex back-end systems
Experience with scrum and associated tools commonly used with it (e.g. Jira)
Good design skills when it comes to producing architectural diagrams, wireframes, sequence diagrams and other design artefacts.
Experience working on products where data engineers, analysts, and scientists are the end users
Experience in being a developer evangelist - continuously communicate benefits of the tools and platforms, create content or materials for purpose of adoption, and conducting workshops
Basic knowledge about batch and stream data processing, data warehousing, data architecture and data governance. Knowledge about technologies such as Kafka, Spark/Flink/Dataflow, Airflow, BigQuery/Redshift/Snowflake, Kubernetes, etc.
Experience designing products to run on cloud computing platforms like GCP or AWS
Being able to monitor and anticipate technology trends
Being able to build relationships with all the key users / stakeholders of the data platform to ensure there is ongoing customer listening, both to determine new needs and assess where existing product is not meeting their needs
Being able to define, measure, and continuously evaluate the measure of success for the platform
Chapter lead component
The data solutions teams are responsible for working with the different areas of the business (internally called tribes), to help solve problems using data. Examples of tribes and associated data solutions teams include marketing, operations, credit risk, fraud & AML, finance, and a number of teams for digital platform which is the area responsible for building the core digital banking products. The teams right now consist of a mix of data engineers and data scientists, with a data product owner per team. The responsibilities of the data product chapter lead in this respect will be to help provide oversight and mentorship across the data product owners to ensure:
Standardardization of ways of working
Best practices are established
Knowledge sharing and continuous learning
Data POs have the support they need to do their jobs, particularly as it relates to stakeholder management
Helping the POs from the different teams set and measure OKRs
Defining key metrics / indicators to measure progress and success of the Products. Designing dashboards to track these.
In this respect prior experience managing product owners is required.

column7:
We are seeking an individual with tenured commissioning experience in complex technology facilities for the position of Mechanical Commissioning Engineer(CxEng) at Fortis Construction Pte. Ltd. Singapore (Fortis). The CxEng is responsible for implementation, monitoring, deployment and conformance to Fortis commissioning program guidelines and supporting processes/procedures throughout the organization. The candidate will work directly with Fortis senior management, our trade partners, equipment vendors, owner, and third-party CX consultants.
Reporting to the Commissioning Manager on a specific site, the CxEng will be accountable for implementing and successfully executing Fortis corporate commissioning program.
It is expected that the CxEng will be a very detailed individual with extensive experience commissioning large complex projects such as industrial plants, data centers and pharmaceutical plants. The successful CxEng must have excellent Emotional Quotient (EQ) skills and be able to relate to and communicate with construction workers, Fortis client, the Fortis management team and subcontractors of all tiers.
Responsibilities Specific to the Role:
Integrate and work as part of a true One Team approach on the project working closely with Fortis co-workers, subcontractors, owner, and 3rd Party QC and Cx teams.
Review all project documents including design drawings, equipment submittal, specifications, and Quality Control plan, and understand project requirements pertaining to start-up and commissioning.
BIM 360 Field software has been selected by the owner for tracking of all QA/QC documentation and deficiency logs for the project. The CxEng will attend Fortis training on the software and is expected to become proficient with the software and its capabilities.
Review Project Equipment Tracking Log which serves as the Inspection and Test Plan for all major MEP equipment. Oversee and ensure the required inspections and tests are carried out in accordance with the approved plan.
Assist in the development of the detailed L3 (Start-Up) micro schedule that includes all inspections, energization, start-up, and testing required to reach L4 Readiness.
Review and verify subcontractor QA/QC documentation is completed in accordance with project requirements and QA/QC plan. Ensure all previous documentation is complete on predecessor tasks prior to proceeding to the next phases (i.e. verify all L2 documentation is complete prior to starting L3).
Perform in-depth review of subcontractor QC forms to verify accuracy and completion. Identify deficiencies and follow-up with subcontractors for resolution.
Conduct detailed review of owner's Cx Agent L4 schedule and ensure subcontractor and vendor resources are scheduled to support testing.
Review Cx Agent's load bank plan and ensure electrical contractor has proper staff and equipment to meet testing requirements.
Work closely with OFCI vendors for scheduling on-site support during construction and commissioning to resolve any issues they are responsible for.
Review and approve critical start-up procedures such as energization and testing/flushing plans.
Participate in Energy Marshall program which governs management of LOTO, equipment energizations, and operation of mechanical systems. Ensure electrical and mechanical trade partners follow the proper procedures and maintain safety requirement during inspection, energization, start-up, and equipment testing.
Work closely with vendors, including attending factory witness tests, scheduling vendor technicians for startup, commissioning, and other project requirements.
Participate in commissioning script writing & review process.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelors and or advanced degrees in a technical engineering field.
5+ years of experience working in various construction commissioning roles on site.
Thorough knowledge of Air Conditioning and Mechanical Ventilation for industrial applications.
Computer literacy in cloud-based systems.
Significant experience with Excel, Word, and other computer-based tools.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Fluent in English

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides companies of all s with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud (cloud computing). Customers across Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ), as well as hundreds of thousands of customers in more than 190 countries are able to use compute power, storage, and many other services - gaining access to a suite of elastic IT infrastructure services as your business demands them.

AWS is seeking an innovative, self-directed Campaign Marketing Manager with proven ability to produce an exceptional user experience in virtual event programming and digital campaign execution

The role will also be responsible for the creation of campaign in a box, digital content assets to support our field sales team, including, but not limited to the creation of video, customer emails, media banners and social channel posts. He or She will own online programs for APJ Field Marketing to be delivered to customers and prospects.

The program manager will collaborate with numerous AWS marketing and other cross functional teams like solution architect, business development, partners, and 3rd party vendors. He or she will build a campaign-aligned calendar, and define objectives in collaboration with the field marketing team, and drive awareness/generate leads at AWS. He or She will be responsible for evaluating and reporting on the programs and seeing opportunities for improvement and innovation as you analyze and understand our customer journey and use cases.

Responsibilities:
. Create and successfully drive awareness, adoption, and usage of AWS through innovative, scalable and leveragable campaign assets, webinar series, and customer reference programs.
. Execute on the APJ marketing programs and campaigns to drive business growth and achieve revenue targets across APJ.
. Craft and develop compelling messaging and tools focused on customers (solution videos, customer success stories,etc.) for use of outbound marketing programs, as well as messaging guides and campaign in a box for our field sales teams.
. Collaborate closely with cross functional and regional teams to design and implement programs and campaigns that positively impacts business growth and enhance AWS reputation.
. Manage and establish best practice processes for all digital and social media presences in the APJ region
. Drive success for digital marketing efforts through demand generation programs for pipeline creation & acceleration.
The successful candidate will need to be a motivated self-starter who thrives on working in complex and challenging environments of a rapidly evolving business. He/She needs to be organized and programmatic in his/her approach, comfortable in managing multiple projects, and thrives in a high-pressure and fast paced environment. With a strong desire to roll up his/her sleeves with extensive hands-on experience in managing and promoting online events. Experience in leveraging a variety of digital channels will help ensure success for this position. The candidate must enjoy working with internal and external contacts and should be detail-oriented, results driven, take ownership seriously, and be customer obsessed. The right candidate should demonstrates an unbridled passion for technology and shown entrepreneurial spirit.

Basic Qualifications :
. 8+ years of work experience, preferably in marketing, marketing communications and/or digital/high-technology companies/product.
. Demonstrated success in programs and campaign execution, and/or project management.
. A career path that demonstrates increasing levels of responsibility and proven success delivering measurable marketing results, driving marketing programs to ROI metrics.
. Exceptional written/verbal communication and time management skills.
. Quick-learner with the demonstrated ability to prioritize.
. Ability to work independently and autonomously.
. Degree qualifications (Bachelors or Masters Degree in relevant subject) MBA a plus

Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience working in a fast-paced and highly cross-functional organization.
. Proven success managing time and juggling multiple projects in a high growth environment where priorities shift fast.

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world's leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing startups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.

At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as an Enterprise Account Manager in the Singapore Team at AWS.

As an Enterprise Account Manager, you will be responsible for driving customer digital transformation through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, and developers. You will be a brand custodian working to support our customers, partners and end-users as they work with AWS, and utilise our cloud technology to innovate and improve their business outcomes.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
In this role, you will Learn and Be Curious (see Amazon Leadership Principles) about the entire portfolio of AWS products and services across strategic accounts in the Singapore Market. As a trusted advisor, you will listen to our customers and help solve complex business transformation and growth challenges so they can focus on delivering optimal business results. Your role will include customer engagement and creating a pipeline of strategic accounts while managing existing customers. As builders, we are here to build long-term relationships with our customers. With a strong Bias for Action, you will improve user experiences while engaging with external and internal stakeholders demonstrating 'Customer Obsession.
Want to know more about what it's like to be part of our ASEAN Team at AWS Hear from our builders: ASEAN Builders

#AWSSINGAPORE

Basic Qualifications :
. 10+ Years of experience in technology field sales, or business development
. 10+ years of experience with identifying, developing, negotiating, and closing projects with Enterprise accounts
. Demonstrated experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners.

Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience in selling cloud solutions
. Cross functional engagement experience (Architect, Sales Engineer, Professional Services, Partner or ISV)
. Strong presentation and communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences in business proficient English
. Extensive experience with Singapore Enterprise accounts

column1: Senior Financial Analyst, Global Delivery Center - Singapore
column6: Technical Support  Lead Generation  Management Consulting  Leadership  Modeling  Financial Planning  Investments  Books  Economics  Accounting  Sales strategy  Financial Analysis  Cadence  Consulting  Decision Making  customer advocacy
column7:
The area: Finance
The name Google came from googol, a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
The role: Senior Financial Analyst, Global Delivery Center - Singapore
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges.
Additional Role Description:
Cloud Customer Experience Finance is responsible for expense and business growth planning/forecasting, profit and loss (P&L) reporting, expense management, business growth analysis, and full P&L management for the Cloud Customer Experience (CCE) team. We strive to ensure that Cloud Customer Experience makes smart and data driven financial decisions by being a strategic partner and independent advisor to that team. The Customer Experience team that we support consists of Technical Support, Professional Services Organization (PSO), Learning, Customer Success, Strategic Accounts, and Customer Advocacy groups. In this role, you will play a critical role within the Professional Services group by supporting the Global Delivery Center, which delivers consulting projects for all regions within PSO.
Responsibilities:
- Be the primary Finance business partner for the Global Delivery Center within the Professional Services team.
- Partner cross-functionally with CCE, Cloud Sales, Strategy and Operations, Finance, and Accounting.
- Analyze financial/operational information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposes.
- Track business performance against profit and loss goals by working with key cross-functional partners, and report on key results to CCE leadership.
- Develop and upgrade critical finance processes, business and review cadence, including leading the monthly, quarterly, and annual financial cycle; measure investments efficiency, and drive yearly planning and resource allocation (i.e. headcount/payroll and non-payroll expenses).
Minimum qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
- 7 years of experience in Finance Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A), Management consulting, Strategy or Product.
Preferred qualifications:
- Experience working with a professional services business (e.g. the Technology Industry).
- Experience working with large datasets.
- Knowledge of the partner ecosystem, key metrics (e.g., bookings, backlog, business growth), business growth recognition rules, and deals structures; familiarity with the SaaS/Cloud industry.
- Ability to communicate and influence effectively at the executive level; build working relationships across business and technical functions.
- Ability to work in an unstructured, fast-paced environment.
- Excellent analytical and modeling skills.

column1: Oracle on AWS Sales Specialist, ASEAN
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

AWS offers enterprises a number of solutions for migrating and deploying their Oracle enterprise applications on the AWS cloud. Customers can launch entire enterprise software stacks from Oracle on the AWS cloud, and they can build enterprise-grade Oracle applications using database and middleware software from Oracle. Currently AWS supports eBusiness Suite, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, Hyperion and several other Oracle enterprise applications. Oracle customers can also use their existing Oracle database licenses on Amazon EC2 with no additional license fees. So, whether your customer is a long-time Oracle customer or a new user, AWS can get them started quickly.

The Oracle on AWS team engages Oracle enterprise applications customers through two routes to market (RTM): the AWS field and the AWS partner ecosystem. We are seeking a sales professional to extend our customer relationships focused on Oracle on AWS. The candidate will contribute to the overall performance of the business globally measured by revenue growth, net new customer wins, Oracle migrations, and reference wins. You will have a broad role - part market maker, part operator, and part general manager - and will build a strategy focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term. As a self-starter willing to operate in a multifaceted way, you should also have experience in market development of cloud infrastructure and/or enterprise applications. The role will require working with the partner ecosystem to help secure lighthouse customers for new use cases, build scalable go-to-market programs, and further develop partnerships. This is an exciting opportunity to drive the go-to-market definition and execution of AWS's strategy for Oracle on AWS in Southeast Asia.

You possess a business background that enables you to engage at the CXO level, deep experience with Oracle workloads, knowledge of Oracle specific infrastructure solutions that will help drive the Oracle on AWS ecosystem, as well as a sales background that enables you to easily interact with enterprise customers, partners, and the AWS field teams. You also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, and the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.
Basic Qualifications :
. 10+ years of direct/matrix sales, business development, and program management experience
. Prior experience selling and growing Oracle applications businesses
. Experience working with Oracle partners and the Oracle ecosystem
. Experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners
. 50% travel required
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience selling Oracle Applications, Technology, and Infrastructure
. Track record of building rapport with senior customer executives (e.g. CEO, CIO, CTO), building close relationships, and closing large revenue accounts
. Motivated self-starter, proactive, and action-oriented
. Strategic problem solving and collaboration skills
. Presentation and communication skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences (both verbal and written)
. Experience working with cloud computing and related infrastructure

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

column1: Solution Architect, ASEAN, Oracle Apps on AWS
column7:
Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

AWS offers enterprises a number of solutions for migrating and deploying their Oracle enterprise applications on the AWS cloud. Customers can launch entire enterprise software stacks from Oracle on the AWS cloud, and they can build enterprise-grade Oracle applications using database and middleware software from Oracle. Currently AWS supports eBusiness Suite, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, Hyperion and several other Oracle enterprise applications. Oracle customers can also use their existing Oracle database licenses on Amazon EC2 with no additional license fees. So, whether your customer is a long-time Oracle customer or a new user, AWS can get them started quickly.

As an Oracle Apps on AWS, Solutions Architect, you will work directly with customers to develop cloud migration strategies for their business-critical Oracle systems. You will be a key member of the Oracle go-to-market (GTM) team, which is focused on winning new customer segments and growing existing customer segments for the long term. This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing organization and drive AWS's Oracle Apps on AWS strategy.

The ideal candidate will possess deep technical skills in Oracle ERP products, IT infrastructure, and cloud computing. In addition, the candidate must have excellent customer facing skills that will enable you to represent AWS and earn trust with customers at multiple levels (architect, administrators, IT managers, CIO, procurement). The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate the ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.

Key job responsibilities
. Respond to detailed client and prospect proposals (RFP/RFI/RFx)
. Engage with customers to develop an approach to migrate complex, on-premise landscapes to the cloud
. Execute customer facing technology and innovation workshops
. Create solution prototypes to meet customer requirements
. Assist customers with complex solution sizing of technology components (O/S, Database, Data Warehouses, Data Lakes)
. Engage with customers to model and design their current state architecture, target state architecture, and transition architecture
. Demonstrate a technical expertise in Oracle Apps system administration, including backup and recovery, database tuning and health checks, system installation, HA/DR, and security.
. Develop and deliver customer-facing technology content including whitepapers, blogs, podcast, videos, and presentations.
. Significant travel is expected.
Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of experience in infrastructure and database architecture, technical pre-sales, technology transformation, enterprise solution blue printing, or Solution Architect experience in the software or cloud industries.
. Experience and deep knowledge of Oracle systems (Oracle E-Business suite, Oracle EPM, Hyperion, PeopleSoft, etc.).
. Experience with Oracle migrations, upgrades, and high availability architectures.
. Bachelor's degree, certifications, or similar experiences desired.
Preferred Qualifications :
. Experience working with global, enterprise customers requiring highly available, fault tolerant systems.
. Experience writing, publishing technical whitepapers, and evangelizing.
. Strong verbal and written communications skills.
. Proven ability to deliver results in a matrixed organization
. 50% Travel expected.

What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today.

If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS.

CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY

At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS), an Amazon.com Company, has been the world's leading cloud provider for more than 15 years with the most mature, comprehensive, and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS has over 200 fully featured cloud services, managed from 81 availability zones within 25 geographic regions across the globe. Millions of customers in over 190 countries - from the fastest growing startups to the largest enterprises, through to leading government agencies - all place their trust in AWS to power their infrastructure, and deliver innovation.

At AWS, we refer to ourselves as builders. We are looking for more builders to join our growing and diverse teams in Singapore. Learn more about a career opportunity as an Enterprise Account Manager in the Singapore Team at AWS.

As an Enterprise Account Manager, you will be responsible for driving customer digital transformation through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, and developers. You will be a brand custodian working to support our customers, partners and end-users as they work with AWS, and utilise our cloud technology to innovate and improve their business outcomes.

ABOUT THIS ROLE
In this role, you will Learn and Be Curious (see Amazon Leadership Principles) about the entire portfolio of AWS products and services across strategic accounts in the Singapore Market. As a trusted advisor, you will listen to our customers and help solve complex business transformation and growth challenges so they can focus on delivering optimal business results. Your role will include customer engagement and creating a pipeline of strategic accounts while managing existing customers. As builders, we are here to build long-term relationships with our customers. With a strong Bias for Action, you will improve user experiences while engaging with external and internal stakeholders demonstrating 'Customer Obsession.
Want to know more about what it's like to be part of our ASEAN Team at AWS Hear from our builders: ASEAN Builders

Job Description :
Job summary
We have an opening for a Program Manager to support the Regional Public Sector Independent Software Vendor (ISV) business. This role presents an exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mindshare and adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) amongst ISVs in the public sector.

In this role, you will be focused on accelerating growth with our ISV partners, through working with the AWS Partner Network team and ISV Partner leaders to build and experiment with region-wide go-to-market strategies and scale best practices.

The ideal candidate earns trust through performance and relationship building, and thinks strategically and analytically about business challenges. The candidate should also be a self-starter with a passion for identifying and eliminating bottlenecks, simplifying where there's complexity, and has the foresight to anticipate business needs, make trade-offs, and balance business dynamics despite constraints.

Key job responsibilities
. Develop and mature mechanisms to deeply understand customer and partner needs, gaps, and opportunities
. Create a framework to prioritize and scale GTM support across our ISV database
. Enable and engage AWS field sales teams on ISV solutions, and relevant programs
. Operationalize ISV programs in region including program recruitment, adoption, reporting, feature roadmap, and problem resolution
. Build and execute a communications strategy to stakeholders including ownership of business cadence
. Provide feedback to global teams on partner programs relevant to ISVs

About the team
The Regional ISV Team (Public Sector) provides named co-sell support for strategic ISV partners. We work backwards from the unique needs of each Partner to create the right approach for each partner. Our goal is to be our ISV's best co-selling partner, period.

We celebrate diversity of background, thought, and identity. When we hire, we look for those who are Amazonian rather than for someone who fits an exact resume mold.
Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of strategy experience focused on ISV sales strategy, business strategy or corporate strategy
. 5+ years of experience working within a global technology/software company, or top tier management consulting firm
. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, and ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
. Highly organized, have multi-tasking skills, and efficient in ambiguous situations
. Detail-oriented with the ability to see the bigger picture and prioritize for the long-term
Preferred Qualifications :
. ISV GTM experience, specifically in joint GTM programs, sales resource, GTM strategy related projects
. Familiarity with AWS, cloud architecture, and/or SaaS
. Exceptional financial and business acumen, experience in providing data driven recommendations to senior sales leadership.

column6: Application Development  Python  Java  Databases  Software Development  Derivatives  Analytical Skills  Interpersonal Skills  Investments  Investigation  Investment Banking  Problem Solving  Risk Management  Economics  Banking  Team Player  Financial Services  Equities
column7:
Your background
Extensive hands-on programming skills in Python
University degree, preferably in Computer Science or equivalent
Excellent analytical and problem solving / investigation abilities
Good interpersonal skills as a team member
Proactive in tackling technical problems
Willingness to pick up new skills when needed
Excellent verbal / written skills
Ability to balance the need for high quality output with the need to meet tight deadlines
Willing to interact with global teams to drive initiatives from APAC region.
Strong understanding of agile methodology, test driven development and continuous integration
Nice to have:
Experience in financial industry (asset classes like Fixed Income or Equities)
Quantitative analytical skills and working knowledge towards derivatives / financial products
Understanding of economics and non-economics of the flow products traded in the market.
Experience in supporting Front Office in Trade Capture, Risk and PL
Awareness and experience within emerging technologies (Eg: Data technologies such as Hadoop/Kafka or similar, or Cloud technologies etc.)
What you can expect
Quartz is an integrated front-to-back Python-based Position Management, Pricing, Risk Management and Sales/Trading system for all financial instruments across all Global Markets business lines.
The role is for a position which will contribute into the Quartz echo-system, driving evolution of the Front Office Trading experience within the key areas of Pricing, Risk/PL and Trade Capture. You will drive efficiencies by consolidating platforms and enabling low touch integrations developed on top of foundational cross product components serving all lines of businesses. You are expected to contribute into core foundational components, as well as delivering solutions to the lines of businesses leveraging these components.
The successful candidate will be responsible for developing high-quality software on timescales in an intellectually challenging environment. This person is required to become proficient in the tools and processes of the team in a short space of time, and will be expected to make an ongoing contribution to improving the design, performance and auditable quality of the overall solution, as well as align the team to the strategic roadmap for Global Markets.
What you will do
Responsible for design and developing software in Python and associated technologies using the Quartz platform.
Contribute to the architecture and design of a high-performing, multi-asset class Trade Capture/Risk/Data platforms with flexible analytics and tests simulations.
Work as part of a global development team, to ensure that global tools and technologies are leveraged.
Responsible for providing specific, measurable and accurate estimates on short timescales in an intellectually challenging environment
Take business specific requirements and implement them in a generic and flexible manner to enable reuse.
About Bank of America
Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.
Connecting Asia Pacific to the world
Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region's leading financial services companies.

Nera Telecommunications Ltd (Nera) is a premium IT infrastructure provider, focusing on end to end solutions. With 40 years of success as a technology solution provider and enabler of business in over 16 countries across 4 different continents, Nera continues to position itself to meet the needs of tomorrow while bolstered by their solid track record.
We are available at www.nera.net.
We are looking for a talented candidate for the following position:
Senior Solutions Engineer / Architect
Roles & Responsibilities:
Responsible for architecting the next generation IP and data transport network architecture leveraging networking experience
Interpret requirements and aligning these to business and technology strategies, policies, and enterprise architectures
Develop the infrastructure architecture considering service level, availability, continuity, suppliers, security, and capacity management requirements
Create end-to-end high-level solutions to meet overall network requirements and product-specific business needs
Work closely within the team to understand stakeholder requirements, developing high quality, architecturally sound systems that align with business needs
Establishing technical standards and drive overall solution architectures, engineering practices and methodologies
Develop business logic with measurable outcomes
Identify opportunities to apply technology trends and innovatively apply these trends to solve business and technical problems
Improved business flexibility delivered via a clear framework, defined structure, and standards.
Improve availability, reliability, and security of mission-critical services.
Communicate complex multi-discipline technology problems and recommended solutions to a diverse audience
Lead or participate in the creation and evaluation of tenders, developing and presenting recommendations to stakeholders for approval
Mentor, assist and plan technical training of engineers and colleagues
Create and update service documentation regularly for new features, security, or business requirements
Analyze current Customers system architecture and identify opportunities for growth and improvement
Create end-to-end high-level solutions to meet overall network requirements and product-specific business needs
Work closely within the team to understand stakeholder requirements, developing high quality, architecturally sound systems that align with business needs
Establishing technical standards and drive overall solution architectures, engineering practices and methodologies
Develop business logic with measurable outcomes
Work as part of a team to provide support for both the business and customers
Advanced knowledge of hardware and software limitations and specifications to succeed
Responsible for architectural of next-generation IP and data transport network architecture leveraging networking experience
Develop the infrastructure architecture considering service level, availability, continuity, suppliers, security and capacity management requirements
Lead or participate in the creation and evaluation of tenders, developing and presenting recommendations to stakeholders for approval
Self-Starter with a strong sense of responsibility, initiative, urgency, and commitment
Requirements:
Tertiary education in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or a related field
Over 3 years experience in the same or related role (pre-sales consultancy experience is a plus)
Understanding of protocols to implement IP Networks and transport networks including BGP, MPLS and OSPF
Understanding of network function virtualization (NFV)
Understanding of software-defined networking (SDN) including OpenFlow, Netconf, YANG, PCEP etc
Experience in identifying strengths and weaknesses of different technologies and architectures
Experience in architecting IP (wired, wireless) and data transport telecommunications networks
Understand the standardization process employed in the industry and the nature of standards bodies
Strong understanding of various software architectures (Web, Cloud, Integration) and methodologies
Experience with Enterprise Architecture best practice and goals (recognized EA certification is a plus)
Excellent verbal communication and presentation skills are essential
Highly organized with exceptional creativity and management skills
Nera is committed to offering our employees a safe, engaging and fulfilling workplace, with considerable opportunities for advancement.
If you are interested in joining our team, please submit your detailed resume with information on your current salary, expected salary and date of availability.

column7:
We are seeking an individual with mechanical, electrical, or plumbing technical experience for the position of MEP Site Supervisor at Fortis Construction Pte. Ltd. Singapore operations. The candidate will work directly with the MEP Construction Manager and the subcontractors throughout the six-year construction phase of the largest multistory data center in Asia (The Project).
Reporting to the MEP Construction Manager, the candidate will be responsible for coordinating site-related works with the mechanical, electrical, or plumbing Subcontractors to perform their scope of work in the strictest of compliance to the contract documents. This role is focused on working in the field and will report directly to the MEP Construction Manager. This candidate should understand all aspects of construction in relation to executing work on-site
It is expected that the candidate will be detail-oriented with previous experience working as a mechanical, electrical, or plumbing Site Supervisor on data center projects and/or other complex technical projects. There will be a significant amount of hands on work coordinating with contractors in the field during the installation of all aspects of the project superstructure. The candidate must have strong Emotional Quotient (EQ) skills and be able to relate to and communicate with the client, the Fortis Construction Pte. Ltd. team, subcontractors of all tiers, vendors and immediately establish trust and confidence in his/her ability.
Responsibilities:
Represent Fortis Construction Pte. Ltd. in the utmost professional manner while constantly embracing honesty, integrity, and truth
Comply with Fortis Construction Pte. Ltd. anti-graft, non-bribery requirements
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the contract documents (drawings and specifications), phasing plans, structural systems interrelationships, construction sequencing, and project schedule
Attend daily job site safety meetings and perform weekly project safety audits
Work with the project safety team to ensure all works are being carried out to the highest levels of safety
Coordinate with on-site Resident Technical Officers (RTOs) and Resident Engineers( REs) for all required inspections and work verification
Develop look-ahead schedules and assist the MEP Construction manager in long range planning
Facilitate problem solving, as may arise, between structural, architectural, mechanical, electrical and CSA subcontractors during construction

column7:
About us
Portofino is a blockchain based digital asset start-up located in the Crypto Valley. Our headquarters are in Zug, Switzerland with offices in London, Singapore and New York.
Backed by the biggest VCs in the world, we aim to build the best digital asset platform in order to become the world's leading crypto-currency market maker.Our first mission is to build & deploy a high frequency trading system in digital asset markets. Being an early stage, scaling start-up and are able to provide you with a large scope of projects in a competitive environment.
Do you want to join our growing team in Singapore We are looking for 2 senior quantitative researchers to join us at the earliest possible.
Scope of the role
Quantitative Researchers play a key role on the Quantitative Research (QR) team, which is responsible for defining trading strategies using sophisticated statistical techniques.
Your responsibilities
Generating ideas about signals regarding market raw data,verify and validate hypothesis
Using statistical analysis and machine learning to generate alpha signals for defining trading strategies
Back-testing hypotheses, building predictive models, and producing systematic strategies
Your profile
Advanced training in Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or another highly quantitative field (Bachelor's, Master's, PhD degree)
Minimum 2 years of relevant job experience in quantitative research or quantitative analysis (preferably in a high frequency trading firm)
Strong knowledge of probability and statistics (e.g.,machine learning, time-series analysis, pattern recognition, NLP)
Prior experience working in a data driven research environment and good understanding of big data problematics
Expert troubleshooting abilities with strong debugging and problem solving skills
Experience in the financial market and trading environment
Required technical competencies (must have)
Expert in Python (Pandas,NumPy, scikit learn, Tensorflow, matplotlib etc...) preferably with intermediate knowledge of C++
Intermediate to very good knowledge of database applications (MongoDB, KDB)
Familiar with all phases of Software Development Life Cycle (unit testing, automatic build and release, peer-review, Jenkins, Jira, GNU Make / Cmake)
Preferred technical competencies
Advanced knowledge in algorithms, network programming, operating systems, compilers
Experience with running code in containerized environments is a plus, especially Docker and Kubernetes
Experience with AWS (or other cloud software/infra)
Your personality
You are a team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.
You are a proactive person who takes initiative, likes to challenge yourself and is willing to go the extra mile to achieve individual as well as team goals.
You can work in a team as well as by yourself and can work under pressure to meet deadlines.
You speak fluent English and enjoy working in an international environment. Our business language is English and in this role you will regularly interact with team members in international locations.
Our offer
We can offer you excellent career opportunities with complete project responsibility right from the beginning
You will be part of an international team and will have the opportunity to learn from as well as work together with industry experts
We offer a flat hierarchy where every employee has equal chance to present their ideas and be part of a scaling business at a very exciting stage of the company
We work hard and celebrate every success. We celebrate often
You grow as we grow
Interested Then apply directly or contact us at [HIDDEN TEXT]
We look forward to your application!

Job Description :

At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.
Join us and experience what it's like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let's create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.
Cloud Partner Manager
Singtel is at the leading edge of technology development to improve the experience of our customers as they consume services across mobile, voice and data infrastructure, managed services, cloud computing, IT services, professional consulting and Managed Services. To support that journey, we are searching for top talent and have an exciting opportunity for a Cloud Partner Manager to develop, oversee optimize our Partner relationships in the best interests of Singtel and our customers.
Reporting to the Director (Cloud Product Management & Partnerships) the person in this position will have direct responsibility for managing and appointing different Cloud and IT Partners, negotiating contracts, evaluating performance, managing relationships with different Partners, progress through the different Partner Tiers and specializations, resolve issues, and streamline engagement processes. This career requires strong interpersonal skills, as well as organizational, problem-solving and creative thinking skills
The candidate will also be responsible for building close executive level relationships between Singtel and the Partners, understand and negotiate contracts, getting access to and maximizing Partner funding and rebate mechanisms, as well as access partner collaterals and marketing resources to enable the Cloud Products Team to build new products and accelerate GTM.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Developing and sustaining long-standing relationships selected Cloud and IT Partners.
Establishing strategic relationships with key Partner partners.
Engage Partners closely to ensure we get early access to the latest developments and offerings which are relevant to Cloud. Ensure Partners conduct enablement / briefing sessions to relevant Cloud personnel from the Cloud Products, Sales Specialists, Pre Sales, and Delivery teams
Access comprehensive partner resources and collaterals to facilitate Cloud Product Managers and Marketing Managers to build compelling Sales Kits, Playbooks, Service SOWs, Sandboxes, Trials and run GTM initiatives.
Identify relevant Training and certification, obtain associated funding / credits, and work with cross functional stakeholders to develop and execute a training / certification roadmap
Have a deep understanding of the respective Partner Partner programs, whether it is for Resale or on a Managed Service Provider / Cloud Service Provider model.
Work with cross functional stakeholders to progress through Partner Tiers and achieve selected specializations and competencies
Maximize partner discounts, rebates and other funding mechanisms to improve our competitiveness and profitability
Conducting research on new Partners, working in collaboration with the Cloud Product team to identify suitable Partners,
Negotiate Partner contracts, work through the Singtel governance mechanisms to on-board new Partners
Collaborate with procurement to measure, analyze and optimize Partner Revenue and margin performance. Continually monitor sales trends to determine which products or solutions are more successful in the market.

Education and Qualifications
Degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
Minimum 5 years experience in Partner Management
Cloud Certification would be advantageous.
AWS, Azure or GCP associate certification
Experience in Business Development, or Product Management.

Work Experience
You have experience in Partner management, partnerships or alliance management roles.
You are self-starter who can also work with a team to deliver business outcomes and results
You have a strong analytical background with an aptitude for understanding technology
Understanding of Cloud solutions, Cloud Tooling and Cloud Services
Experience in working in large ICT organizations
Familiarization with Cloud Discovery, Cloud Security, DevOps, FinOps, etc.
Proficiency in Partner programs, managing Partner portals, incentives, and funding

We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

This exciting role in Ashnik's consulting team brings great opportunity to design and deploy Kubernetes platform solution for Ashnik's enterprise customers spread across SEA and India. This role takes a lead in consulting the customers for adoption of Kubernetes platform for their Digital Transformation journey.

To lead the consultative discussions to identify challenges for the customers, suggest right fit open-source components and suggest appropriate Kubernetes platform
To create consulting work packages and assist sales team to position them to enterprise customers

To lead the implementation and get customer sign-off

You would be adding a great experience of working with a leading open-source solutions company in the Southeast Asia region to your career. You would get to learn from the leaders and grow in the industry. This would be a great opportunity for you to grow in your career through continuous learning, adding depth and breadth to technologies. Since we work with leading open-source technologies, Cloud and Kubernetes platforms, and engage with large enterprises, it creates enormous possibilities for career growth for our team. Not to mention that our people find the journey with Ashnik to be exciting and a fulfilling experience.
About Us
Ashnik is a leading enterprise open-source solutions company in Southeast Asia and India, enabling organizations to adopt open source for their digital transformation goals. Founded in 2009, it offers a full-fledged Open-Source Marketplace, Solutions, and Services Consulting, Managed, Technical, Training. Over 200 leading enterprises so far have leveraged Ashnik's offerings in the space of Database platforms, DevOps & Microservices, Kubernetes, Cloud, and Analytics.
As a team culture, Ashnik is a family for its team members. Each member brings in a different perspective, new ideas and diverse background. Yet we all together strive for one goal to deliver the best solutions to our customers using open-source software. We passionately believe in the power of collaboration. Through an open platform of idea exchange, we create a vibrant environment for growth and excellence.
